column4: Do I need to use the Ubuntu amd64 version to fully utilize the extra memory, or what?
I don't suppose I can 'upgrade' to the 64-bit version, can I?
Should I not have at least 4gb available right now?
Instead of 2.7?
Hmm.
So cat /proc/meminfo and free -m report 2.7GB, and the other 1.3 is used for other stuff?
Oh.
Ok
Weeell.
If I reinstall, will I keep my data if I don't reformat?
it's not used, but not addressable
you can either use PAE or go 64bit.. I would recommend the later
nope.. you're looking at a reinstall
some of it is used for hardware mapping and other stuff
usually you end up with something like 3 GB.
but it differs depending on what hardware you have installed
I would suggest you backup your data.. I think it will still be there after a reinstall.. but I'm not sure and things might go wrong on the way.. backups are good
I certainly will!
hmm.. xeon.. try the live cd first.. not sure if you want AMD64 or X86_64
n00p, thank you for your help.  I'll create my rsync'd backups to my other systems and upgrade this puppy.
good luck
